references.fullname_first_author: Diederik P. Kingma and Max Welling
references.reason: This paper introduced the foundational concept of Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), which are fundamental to many modern video generation and compression techniques, including the VidTok architecture.

references.fullname_first_author: Aaron Van Den Oord, Oriol Vinyals
references.reason: This paper introduced Vector Quantized Variational Autoencoders (VQ-VAEs), a crucial technique for learning discrete latent representations, which is directly compared against and improved upon by the VidTok model's Finite Scalar Quantization (FSQ) method.

references.fullname_first_author: Robin Rombach, Andreas Blattmann, Dominik Lorenz, Patrick Esser, and Björn Ommer
references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This highly influential work introduced latent diffusion models, which are a cornerstone of modern image and video generation and are explicitly cited as an important related work demonstrating the state-of-the-art for continuous video tokenization.

references.fullname_first_author: Jonathan Ho, Ajay Jain, and Pieter Abbeel
references.reason: This work provided a foundational framework for diffusion models, a crucial class of generative models used in advanced video generation methods and is directly relevant to the continuous tokenization approaches in the VidTok paper.

references.fullname_first_author: Lijun Yu, Yong Cheng, Kihyuk Sohn, José Lezama, Han Zhang, Huiwen Chang, Alexander G Hauptmann, Ming-Hsuan Yang, Yuan Hao, Irfan Essa
references.reason: This paper introduces MAGVIT, a state-of-the-art video tokenizer that directly competes with VidTok.  It serves as a key baseline against which VidTok's performance is measured and improved upon.
